contents.title: Getting Started with Nuxt 3: A Complete Guide
contents.description: Learn how to build modern web applications with Nuxt 3, the powerful Vue.js framework that makes development faster and more enjoyable.
contents.author: Beviryon Issanga Ngoulou

children.value: Getting Started with Nuxt 3: A Complete Guide

Nuxt 3 is the latest version of the popular Vue.js framework that makes building modern web applications a breeze. With its powerful features like server-side rendering, static site generation, and automatic code splitting, Nuxt 3 is the perfect choice for developers who want to create fast, SEO-friendly applications.
Nuxt 3 is a powerful framework built on top of Vue.js that provides:
- Better SEO and initial page load performance
- No need to manually import components and composables
- Automatic routing based on your file structure
- Built-in TypeScript support out of the box
Getting started with Nuxt 3 is simple. You can create a new project using the following command:

props.code:
npx nuxi@latest init my-nuxt-app
cd my-nuxt-app
npm install
npm run dev

children.value: A typical Nuxt 3 project has the following structure:

props.code:
my-nuxt-app/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/          # Uncompiled assets (SCSS, images, etc.)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/      # Vue components
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ composables/     # Vue composables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ layouts/         # Layout components
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ middleware/      # Route middleware
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pages/           # File-based routing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins/         # Plugins
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/          # Static assets
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server/          # Server-side code
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ nuxt.config.ts   # Nuxt configuration

Nuxt 3 automatically imports components, composables, and utilities, so you don't need to manually import them:
Create routes by simply adding files to the

props.code:
pages/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.vue        # /
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ about.vue        # /about

children.value: Nuxt 3 provides excellent SSR capabilities out of the box:
// This will be executed on the server
- Enable TypeScript for better development experience
- Use the built-in image optimization features
- Build API routes directly in your Nuxt app
- Take advantage of the auto-import feature

Nuxt 3 is a powerful framework that makes building modern web applications easier and more enjoyable. With its excellent developer experience, performance optimizations, and rich ecosystem, it's the perfect choice for your next project.
Start building with Nuxt 3 today and experience the future of Vue.js development!

// app/login/page.tsx "use client" import { useState } from "react" import { signIn } from "next-auth/react" import { useRouter } from "next/navigation" export default function LoginPage() { const [userType, setUserType] = useState<"student" | "admin">("student") const [credentials, setCredentials] = useState({ email: "", password: "" }) const router = useRouter() const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) => { e.preventDefault() const result = await signIn("credentials", { email: credentials.email, password: credentials.password, userType: userType, redirect: false }) if (result?.ok) { router.push(`/${userType}/dashboard`) } else { // Gestion des erreurs console.error("Erreur de connexion") } } return (

// types/user.ts
export interface User {
  id: string
  email: string
  name: string
  role: "student" | "admin"
  avatar?: string
  createdAt: Date
  lastLogin?: Date
}

export interface Student extends User {
  role: "student"
  courses: Course[]
  progress: Progress[]
  grades: Grade[]
}

export interface Admin extends User {
  role: "admin"
  permissions: Permission[]
  managedCourses: Course[]
}

export interface Course {
  id: string
  title: string
  description: string
  instructor: string
  duration: number
  lessons: Lesson[]
  students: string[]
  createdAt: Date
}

export interface Lesson {
  id: string
  title: string
  content: string
  videoUrl?: string
  duration: number
  order: number
  resources: Resource[]
}

export interface Progress {
  courseId: string
  lessonId: string
  completed: boolean
  completedAt?: Date
  timeSpent: number
}

üí° Mes conseils pour les futurs d√©veloppeurs
La technologie √©volue rapidement. Il est essentiel de rester √† jour avec les derni√®res tendances et d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies r√©guli√®rement.
La th√©orie est importante, mais la pratique est cruciale. Cr√©ez des projets personnels, participez √† des hackathons, contribuez √† l'open source.
Un bon d√©veloppeur ne se contente pas de coder. Il comprend les besoins m√©tier et propose des solutions adapt√©es.
La communication est essentielle, que ce soit avec les clients, les coll√®gues ou la communaut√©. Apprenez √† expliquer des concepts techniques de mani√®re accessible.
Commencez par √™tre g√©n√©raliste, puis sp√©cialisez-vous dans des domaines qui vous passionnent.
Je m'efforce de livrer du code de qualit√©, bien document√© et maintenable. Chaque projet est une opportunit√© d'apprendre et de s'am√©liorer.
J'aime explorer de nouvelles technologies et approches pour r√©soudre des probl√®mes de mani√®re cr√©ative et efficace.
Je crois en la force du travail d'√©quipe et en l'importance de partager les connaissances pour faire progresser collectivement.
Mon objectif est de cr√©er des solutions qui ont un impact positif sur les utilisateurs et les entreprises.

Si vous souhaitez discuter de projets, de collaboration ou simplement √©changer sur le d√©veloppement web, n'h√©sitez pas √† me contacter ! Je suis toujours ouvert aux nouvelles opportunit√©s et aux discussions enrichissantes.
Merci d'avoir lu mon parcours ! J'esp√®re que cet article vous a donn√© un aper√ßu de mon cheminement et de mes aspirations. N'h√©sitez pas √† partager votre propre parcours en commentaire !

// src/types/index.ts
export interface Activity {
  id: string
  title: string
  description: string
  category: 'fitness' | 'culturel' | 'cardio'
  duration: number
  difficulty: 'd√©butant' | 'interm√©diaire' | 'avanc√©'
  instructor: string
  schedule: Schedule[]
  price: number
  image: string
  maxParticipants: number
  currentParticipants: number
}

export interface Schedule {
  day: string
  time: string
  location: string
}

export interface Event {
  id: string
  title: string
  description: string
  date: Date
  location: string
  price: number
  image: string
  maxParticipants: number
  currentParticipants: number
  category: 'tournoi' | 'atelier' | 'comp√©tition' | '√©v√©nement'
}

export interface Member {
  id: string
  name: string
  email: string
  phone: string
  activities: string[]
  events: string[]
  joinDate: Date
  membershipType: 'mensuel' | 'trimestriel' | 'annuel'
}

export interface ContactForm {
  name: string
  email: string
  phone: string
  message: string
  activity: string
}

<!-- src/components/ui/Button.vue -->
<template>
  <button
    :class="[
      'px-6 py-3 rounded-lg font-semibold transition-all duration-200 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2',
      variantClasses[variant],
      sizeClasses[size],
      disabled ? 'opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed' : 'hover:scale-105'
    ]"
    :disabled="disabled"
    @click="$emit('click')"
  >
    <slot />
  </button>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
interface Props {
  variant?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'outline'
  size?: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg'
  disabled?: boolean
}

const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {
  variant: 'primary',
  size: 'md',
  disabled: false
})

defineEmits<{
  click: []
}>()

const variantClasses = {
  primary: 'bg-primary-500 hover:bg-primary-600 text-white focus:ring-primary-300',
  secondary: 'bg-secondary-500 hover:bg-secondary-600 text-white focus:ring-secondary-300',
  outline: 'border-2 border-primary-500 text-primary-500 hover:bg-primary-50 focus:ring-primary-300'
}

const sizeClasses = {
  sm: 'px-4 py-2 text-sm',
  md: 'px-6 py-3 text-base',
  lg: 'px-8 py-4 text-lg'
}
</script>

children.value: 'px-6 py-3 rounded-lg font-semibold transition-all duration-200 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2'
: Bouton flottant avec animation et instructions claires
: Lazy loading, compression d'images, cache intelligent
: Design simple, navigation claire, feedback visuel

FlexBeat est un exemple parfait de PWA moderne qui combine performance, design et fonctionnalit√©s natives. Cette approche permet de cr√©er des exp√©riences utilisateur exceptionnelles tout en restant accessible sur le web.

contents.title: TailwindCSS Best Practices for Modern Web Development
contents.description: Learn the best practices for using TailwindCSS effectively in your projects. From component design to performance optimization.
contents.author: Beviryon Issanga Ngoulou

children.value: TailwindCSS Best Practices for Modern Web Development

TailwindCSS has revolutionized how we write CSS by providing utility-first classes that make styling faster and more consistent. In this guide, we'll explore the best practices for using TailwindCSS effectively.

TailwindCSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build custom designs directly in your markup. Instead of writing custom CSS, you compose designs using pre-defined classes.

props.code:
npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
npx tailwindcss init -p

children.value: Instead of repeating utility classes, create component classes:
Extend Tailwind's theme with custom properties:
Follow a consistent order for your classes:

props.code: Content

children.value: <!-- Order: layout, spacing, sizing, typography, colors, effects -->
"flex items-center justify-between p-4 w-full text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md"

Enable Just-In-Time compilation for faster builds:

props.code: npx tailwindcss -i ./src/input.css -o ./dist/output.css --minify

Card Title

Card description goes here.

<!-- Primary Button -->
<button class="bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 transition-colors">
  Primary
</button>

<!-- Secondary Button -->
<button class="border border-blue-600 text-blue-600 px-4 py-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-50 transition-colors">
  Secondary
</button>

TailwindCSS is a powerful tool that can significantly improve your development workflow. By following these best practices, you can create maintainable, performant, and beautiful designs with ease.
Use component classes for repeated patterns
Take advantage of responsive design features
Start implementing these practices in your projects today!

contents.title: Vue 3 Composition API: A Developer's Guide
contents.description: Master the Vue 3 Composition API with this comprehensive guide. Learn about reactive refs, computed properties, and lifecycle hooks.
contents.author: Beviryon Issanga Ngoulou

children.value: Vue 3 Composition API: A Developer's Guide

The Vue 3 Composition API is a powerful new way to write Vue components that provides better code organization, reusability, and TypeScript support. In this guide, we'll explore the key concepts and best practices.

The Composition API is a new way to write Vue components that allows you to organize your code by logical concerns rather than by component options. It provides better code reuse and makes it easier to work with TypeScript.
To use the Composition API, you need to use the
function creates a reactive reference to a value:
Computed properties are reactive and automatically update when their dependencies change:
// fullName will automatically update when firstName or lastName changes
Watchers allow you to perform side effects when reactive data changes:
// You can also watch multiple sources
The Composition API provides lifecycle hooks as functions:
Composables are reusable functions that encapsulate reactive logic:

props.code:
<script setup>
import { useCounter } from '@/composables/useCounter'

const { count, increment, decrement, reset } = useCounter(10)
</script>

children.value: - The Composition API works great with TypeScript
- Be aware of reactivity loss when destructuring
- Don't use watchers for simple computations

The Vue 3 Composition API provides a more flexible and powerful way to write Vue components. With better code organization, improved TypeScript support, and enhanced reusability, it's the future of Vue development.
Start using the Composition API in your projects today and experience the benefits for yourself!
